Question.Text: A 24-Year-Old Man of Turkish Origin With right upper quadrant pain, jaundice, nausea and vomiting. He was diagnosed with CE 3 years earlier and has not been on any specific treatment.

Answer: Cystic echinococcosis (hydatid disease) - The Turkish patient presents with right upper quadrant pain, jaundice, nausea, and vomiting with prior CE (cystic echinococcosis) diagnosis 3 years ago without treatment. The images show large hepatic cystic lesion with daughter cysts and septations on imaging, and Echinococcus granulosus protoscoleces. Hydatid cysts grow slowly over years, can rupture causing anaphylaxis, and require careful surgical or medical management.
